content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice one, easy but tricky
Shortest mode could be very fun here.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I must confess: my interest was raised by seeing 'butt' in the title; I half expected a prompt related to eating too many beans or hot peppers. The statement is short, it is a straightforward neat little puzzle, perfect for a fastest clash.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I already see an algorithm
I am non-native speaker and I was so confused what cigarettes have to do with butts, so maybe better use "cigarette stub"

Goal section
* Please mention that every cigarette smoked results in 1 new butt, otherwise the statement is incomplete in explaining the rules.

* Please change "he can" to "can he".

Constraints section / Cases
* Please either decrease the upper limit of N, or change the cases to cover larger numbers.

Test cases
* Please change the cases so that there are no duplicates.

Thanks.

Hi ! Thanks for the feedback ! 

I have changed most. But I did not understand the changes on the test cases. 

I have included another test, but not sure.

There are a number of inputs that generate the same output. Like 5 and 6 generate a result of 2.  

This is my first attemp to contribute, so any feedback is welcome :)

Thanks !
Hi So_fie, yes maybe I can change that but butts is cool. Thanks for the vote !
Please approve so we can test :)

Thank you for  the reply and making the changes!

While adding an additional pair of test and validator is good, that's not what I meant. Each pair of test and validator should be similar (e.g. in terms of N mod 3 and in terms of magnitude of N), but remain different (e.g. one pair may test N mod 3 = 0 with N being a small number, the test being N = 6 and the validator being N = 9, another pair may test N mod 3 = 1 and N being a bigger number, the test being N = 43 and the validator being N = 58).

The reason is that we should make it difficult for the player to hardcode the solution. If the tests and the validators are the same, you can just write a solution stating that if N = 1 then output 0, if N = 5 then output 2, etc, without writing any code to solve the clash generally.
Ok cool ! Got it. Just changed the test cases and validators. Hope its ok now. Thanks !
